text: Thomas A. Van Meter (April 22, 1943 – March 7, 1992) was a member of the Ohio General Assembly. He served in the Ohio Senate from 1973 to 1982, representing the 19th District. He also ran for the Republican nomination for governor in 1978, eventually losing to former Ohio Governor Jim Rhodes. He eventually returned to the General Assembly, serving in the Ohio House of Representatives for one term. He ran for the Republican nomination in 1982, finishing 3rd to Bud Brown. https://news.google.com/newspapers?nid=1350&dat;=19820603&id;=8goVAAAAIBAJ&sjid;=pwIEAAAAIBAJ&pg;=6982,5662338 He died of cancer in 1992. ==References== Category:1943 births Category:1992 deaths Category:Ohio state senators Category:Ohio Republicans Category:Members of the Ohio House of Representatives Category:People from Ashland, Ohio Category:20th-century American politicians
title: Tom Van Meter
